name: Jason Hubbard
text: These guys are AMAZING! They are extremely knowledgeable about all of the products they sell and the services they offer. I was very surprised at the hometown feel of the shop and the friendliness of everyone there. They are able to take care of any tire needs you have from high performance cars to rock crawling 4 wheel drives. The shop is set up to handle any and all off road performance needs that anyone can have. It is very easy for me to say that after my experience with this wonderful group of gentleman that I will never go anywhere to buy tires again. I was impressed enough with them that my search for a Jeep to build is in high gear now. I'm looking forward to seeing what they can do with it. The best advice I can give to everyone is to check them out for any and all tire needs.

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

text: This is the best shop around, I am fairly new to Off-roading and building a vehicle to do it in. Josh, Devin, and Paul have all been extremely helpful and informative. Devon helped out anytime I called to follow up on when parts where coming in along with the progress during the day of install. Paul man this guy is the one you want looking over labor, he is very OCD about getting it right and not cutting corners and has a wealth of knowledge. Additionally all the staff at Elite are very professional and will answer any question you have, if they can’t answer it then they will make sure they get you the answer with some digging. I will maintain being a happy customer with a trusted shop which is hard to find. I can’t wait to do future building with the Elite family! text: These guys are very transparent and polite. The turn around time was quicker than anticipated. Most importantly, they’re honest and do excellent work. I will not hesitate to use them in the future for vehicle needs and wants.

name: Grant Johnson
text:
Recently bought a new to me Jeep TJ. I couldn’t even drive it home (15 mins away from place of purchase) due to death wobble, loose steering wore out track bar and a laundry list of other issues. I had little to no hope for getting the vehicle street worthy and planned on just keeping it as a dedicated trailer rig. I called Elite and spoke with Josh over the phone, he said they can get it fixed up and back on the road.

They absolutely blew my expectations with the work put in on my jeep. They replaced all heim joints on the steering and track bar as well as completed a full inspection on the vehicle torque checking all nuts and bolts under the vehicle my peace of mind. They even found a few more issues that were fixed in shop for safety reasons on this inspection.

The whole process was seamless from drop off to pickup. Communication was top notch on any issue they ran into along the way. I will absolutely be returning to get my truck leveled with wheels and tires in the near future. Awesome job and awesome company. ⭐️ 12/10stars ⭐️

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review Grant glad we could get your Jeep back drivable!

text: Rip off.. took my Yukon in for an alignment they called and said it was ready. Then told me 119bucks payed they handed me my keys then said oh BTW we couldn't do the alignment it needed new tie rod end inners and ball joints. And said the amount I payed was for the inspection.. I didn't want an inspection but a alignment. So I took the yukon home and replaced all the parts to find out it was fine. Only had alittle play in upper right ball joint the mechanic is a joke only trying to fill his pockets this is why you can't trust auto shops.  Stay away because you are gonna get ripped off!!.  I Am Mike Overton and I Approve This Message!!!

resp.text:
Hey Mike Overton we are sorry you feel this way but we did not perform an alignment due to worn out suspension and steering components. You getting charged was a mistake by your sales person which was corrected and you were given a refund. We pride ourselves in quality work we do not change for a service we cannot perform any other shop would have performed an “Alignment” and not let you know about any front end issues and charged you.

Thanks,
Josh Balch

name: Ken Osvath
text:
Highly recommend.  Thanks once again to Elite Offroad And Performance!  We’ve had great experiences working with Josh and Alex.

Previously EOP had stayed late waiting for a towed Jeep arrival when our son’s track bar mount broke, rendering it un-drivable.

They fixed it in a timely and cost-effective manner, installing a new adjustable track bar and Teraflex front lower adjustable control arms which significantly improved drive quality.

Then recently I swung by and picked up a HIKEit X9 Throttle Controller for my Jeep, from Alex, as a cost-effective performance upgrade.

OMG!  What a difference!   Just as EOP advertised — it’s easy of use, adjustable Throttle Response with 36 settings within its 4-driving modes (Cruise, Sport, Race, Eco/4x4 Crawl) and Auto mode that adjusts dynamically to your driving along with Anti-Theft Password Protected Pedal Lock.   Thanks EOP!

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Mike Cents
text: Matt from Fausak is our go-to guy. His team of mechanics is amazing. Matt consistently has a great attitude and always tries to help no matter the issue at hand. Do yourself a favor and acquaint yourself with Fausak.

name: Tony Chapman
text: Stopped by without an appointment due to a tire on my travel trailer losing air. We were greeted and immediately taken into a bay for service, the technician quickly discovered the problem and the tire was repaired and mounted. Very professional service writers and technicians ×ith a new and modern facility. We were back on the road to continue our vacation all within an hour.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, Tony. It was our pleasure to quickly diagnose the issue with your trailer tire and get you back on your vacation in no time!

name: Joan Harris
text: My son got a nail in his tire, and it went flat on the interstate in Mississippi.  When he changed his tire to the spare, he broke the stud that holds the lug nut on.  With some calling and stress, I got him to our vacation spot in Orange beach.  I called Fausak and talked to Raymond (who was very kind). They were so accommodating, fixed his tire, and even found another nail in another tire and fixed it.  They did it quick and we were back to our vacation within an hour.  I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to take care of the punctured tires on your son's vehicle and get your family back to your vacation! We appreciate you sharing this experience and if there are any auto repair or tire services we can assist with in the future, just let us know!

name: M. Tyler Arthur
text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

text: Very honest staff. I own a business that could be considered by some to be "competition" since we repair wheels. They are in business to sell wheels. Instead they will tell them about my company and save their customer money. Some may think that is crazy for them to do but I know that in business that will get you even further.  Most businesses are more concerned with the money now instead of looking at the bigger picture and knowing that doing right by the customer will ultimately make you more in the end! This ace has no customer service. I will pay for my tires but I will never recommend this place to anyone.

text:
Wish I can give a negative star.

Long story short -
Aside from horrible customer interaction, was quoted a Kumho tire for $199.99. Went to Pepboys and NTB, both offered under $130 for the same tire.

Unsure if that employee was trying to just scam and take advantage or this company is just overpriced. It was my first time and would be last.

Glad I researched beforehand. Just be careful and study the materials of service you need done before getting here.

name: Daniel Sigala
text:
The Manager Chris here is way out of his element. I had my truck towed here for work to be done. Prior to having truck brought there I called and spoke to him to be sure that what I need done would be completed by them.

Without even un-mounting the tire to see the puncture they determined it unfixable and I also couldn’t buy a replacement tire I was required to buy 2 tires.

After trying to sell me some tires that were currently mounted on an employees truck. It turns out they didn’t even have the tires in stock that he said they did.

The technician was a down to earth guy and straight forward but honestly held back by company management. This guy Chris is a money shark and doesn’t show the slightest interest in actually helping anyone. More like a money chasing tyrant with a small man complex.

resp.text: Hey Daniel Sigala so sorry to hear your experience wasn't awesome. What can I do to make it right?

Their prices are very competitive and some styles are even priced a bit lower. Next time I need another set of tires I won’t even shop around, I’ll be going straight there.

The staff was incredibly friendly and didn't give me the typical "female" treatment that I have received at other shops in the Auburn/Opelika area.  I will definitely return here for service and recommend them to anyone.

name: Rick
text: There are several things that make this place the best.  I write this review after driving an hour and a half to do business with them.  First off all, they do more than trucks.  30 inch rims for your car they do it, headlights, taillights, lifts, flares, tonneau covers, etc... if you want it they can get it.  There prices are hard to beat.  But let me talk about what sets them apart from everyone besides their exceptional pricing.  From the moment you walk in you are treated with respect and that they are glad to see you there.  They listen very intently to what you want whether in person or on the phone.  This is missed by so many other places.  They go through getting prices as well as can show you options.  They do this to make sure you get exactly what you want for the best price.  While doing so they take notes on the conversation to ensure they don't have to ask you several times because they forgot.  Making sure they stay on top of it and making everything move flawless.  The business is very well maintained and the showroom is definitely a showroom, not just a display, spotless.  Respect and honesty is projected so loudly by the staff, you will feel like its your own family that runs the business.  I can't say enough about this because I have been there a few times for different purchases and  the entire staff is friendly as well as great to interact with.  As I return to them next week to make another purchase, driving an hour and a half versus using the internet, I know I am meeting people who are like family, getting the best price, the right part, quality parts, but also the best service that I have seen in the state.

text: My prices seem to be higher than others that get the same thing done there. I was charged 90 for an oil change and it was just regular oil but the guy after me was only charged 54. Also a 10% fee was added for using my debt card but I had bought tires from there 2 days before and a lady checked me out and there was no 10% fee added on that receipt and I had used the same card. My advice is have them write the price down b4 they start because they will nickel and dime u to death.

resp.text: Jaquana I am sorry you feel this way, however there are a few reasons your oil change was more. 1) Your car required a synthetic oil change which was $47.95. 2) Your car required an air filter, we ask you if you wanted us to change it and gave you the price of the air filter which was $25.13, and you told us to go ahead and change it. 3) We topped off all of your fluids including antifreeze and windshield washer fluid. In regards to the 10% fee for using a debit card, that is just untrue. We have never charged anyone for using their card. I reviewed your ticket and I would be glad to discuss with you further please feel free to give me a call at 334-576-2248. Thank you.

name: phil lindley
text: I used to only drive big name brand tires$$$, which were usually put on at Sam's or Costo. After an issue with one of the $$$ tires purchased, I found out they are not a typical stock item and I'd have to wait for several days. Since I needed it repaired immediately, I drove directly to Pete Shirley and told them to get close on the orginal tires ratings (speed/trac/hardness) with something they normally stock and replace all 4. Not only did they drive the same,  they were significantly cheaper than the big name brands. The biggest plus, I was back on the road in about an hour. I've waited over 4hours at some places in the past. Since, I've replaced tires on my other 4 vehicles using Pete Shirley. Asked them to put on something they normally stocked on these 4 vehicles, and all road out great, and in and out of the store in a timely manner. They also don't sell the gimmicky road side warranty. But I'd bet they'd do all they could to help you out if something happens outside of the tires warranty.
